item.description:
Creating Habitat for Pollinators and Other Beneficial Insects Saturday, June 4th 3:00-4:00 PM

Learn how to provide food and habitat for insects that are beneficial to your garden through a choice of delightful plants. Ways to integrate them into your garden, and perhaps kitchen, will be taught.

There will be a hands on experience of creating a simple Solitary Bee house and a Mason Bee house. each participant will take home one house along with some seeds and/or small plants to get started.

Please wear appropriate clothing and footwear  for a walk about the backyard wilds.

They is a suggested $7 fee to cover  materials. No one will be excluded for lack of funds.
item.how_to_find_us: Join the group near the driveway planters
item.why: We need to give them a place to live so they are near the garden to help.
item.name: Creating Habitat for Pollinators and Other Beneficial Insects
